page.title: 07INTERESTING PEOPLE (Cont)
page.content: Mr. Bleasdale remembers as a young boy, with other children, his visits to a local apple tree, whose branches spread onto the lane convenient for the children to pick apples on the way to and from school. These little interesting excursions are not available to the modern child, at least in this area, the lane now having become a modern metalled road. He also remembers as a young boy collecting coke from the Askam Gas Works to suppliment their meagre coal ration because of the cost of the coal. Concerning todays local children he is of the opinion that they do not have as much to do as he at their age although it would appear to be a more affluent society. Adults and children in those days were content with the simpler things of life.
